required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Japan Phase 2/3 Clinical Study With BLM-240 (Desflurane)
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 2/3 Clinical Study With BLM-240 in Adult Surgery Patients That Need General Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: The purposes of this study are to evaluate the efficacy and safety of desflurane (BLM-240) as an anesthetic agent and to demonstrate the non-inferiority of desflurane to sevoflurane in term of awakening/recovery from anesthesia.

detailed_description.textblock: The study evaluates the efficacy and safety of the use of desflurane (BLM-240) (with and without nitrous oxide) in maintenance of general anesthesia in adult patients undergoing surgical procedures typically performed under general anesthesia in Japan (thoracic, abdominal, joints, back, and neck), where analgesics and muscle relaxants are concomitantly used. The study is also intended to demonstrate the non-inferiority of desflurane with nitrous oxide to sevoflurane with nitrous oxide in time to awakening/recovery.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Body Movement During Anesthetic Maintenance
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
primary_outcome.description: The investigator or sub-investigator observed the patient for body movement (excluding bucking) during anesthetic maintenance.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Recall/Memory Issues During Anesthetic Maintenance
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
primary_outcome.description: The investigator or sub-investigator observed the patient for the presence or absence of awakening during anesthetic maintenance and interviewed the patient on the day after surgery to confirm whether the patient has any memory during anesthetic maintenance.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Requiring Rescue Treatment During Anesthetic Maintenance
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
primary_outcome.description: Rescue medication includes vasopressors and depressors.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Not Receiving Rescue Treatment Whose Blood Pressure/Heart Rate Maintained Above/Below 70%
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
primary_outcome.description: "Rescue medication includes vasopressors and depressors. Percentage of observation points at which systolic pressure 80 to <150 mmHg and heart rate 50 to <100 bpm could be maintained "

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Receiving Rescue Treatment Whose Blood Pressure/Heart Rate Maintained Above/Below 70%
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
primary_outcome.description: Rescue medication includes vasopressors and depressors. Percentage of observation points at which no rescue treatment was judged to be required based on blood pressure/heart rate

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation on the efficacy (ability) of BLM-240 as an anesthetic drug.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Post-Surgery, from end of study drug inhalation to extubation)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of Awakening/Recovery from Anesthesia from end of study drug inhalation to extubation. The patient was extubated when the following signs were observed:(1) clear consciousness, (2) ability to breathe spontaneously (minute ventilation >=50 mL/kg/min), and (3) stable circulatory dynamics (systolic pressure: >=100 mmHg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Post-Surgery, from the end of study drug inhalation to awakening)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the end of study drug inhalation. After the end of inhalation of the study drug, the investigator commanded the patient to open his/her eyes once every minute to check whether he/she awoke and recorded the time of awakening.

After extubation, the investigator called and asked the patient to state the birth date once every minute and recorded the time the patient could state the birth date. Time from the end of study drug inhalation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reaching an Aldrete Score >=8 (Min)
secondary_outcome.description: Score includes a ranking of 0-2 (higher shows improvement) in activity, respiration, circulation, consciousness, and O2 saturation (SpO2). After extubation, the investigator observed the patient's condition every 5 minutes until the Aldrete score reached >=8 and recorded the Aldrete scores at 5-minute intervals.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Post-Surgery, from awakening to before extubation)
secondary_outcome.description: "Clear consciousness" means that patients responded to investigator's command for physical movement such as "hold my finger tight."

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Bispectral Index (BIS) Over Time During Anethetic Maintenance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: BIS is used to monitor depth of anesthesia. The BIS monitor provides a single number, which ranges from 0 (equivalent to EEG silence) to 100. A BIS value between 40 and 60 generally indicates an appropriate level for general anesthesia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Requiring Rescue Medication Due to Rise in Blood Pressure or Heart Rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Rescue medication can include vasopressors and depressors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Requiring Rescue Medication Due to Drop in Blood Pressure or Heart Rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Rescue medication can include vasopressors and depressors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Requiring Rescue Medication Due to Arrhythmia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Rescue medication can include vasopressors and depressors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Range of End-Tidal Anesthetic Percent Concentrations During Anesthetic Maintenance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 [just before the start of inhalation of study drug, during anesthetic maintenance (every 5 minutes after the start of inhalation of study drug), at the end of inhalation of study drug, immediately after awakening, and just before extubation]
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement by infrared absorption spectrometry. The concentrations of BLM-240 and sevoflurane at the start of inhalation were set at 3% and 1%,respectively (by vaporizer dial setting). Concentrations are monitored to determine which levels keep the patient in stable condition without requiring rescue treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Range of Inspired Anesthetic Concentrations Below End-Tidal Anesthetic Percent Concentrations During Anesthetic Maintenance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 [just before the start of inhalation of study drug, during anesthetic maintenance (every 5 minutes after the start of inhalation of study drug), at the end of inhalation of study drug, and just before extubation]
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement by infrared absorption spectrometry. Ranges reflecting when concentrations were stable. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

secondary_outcome.measure: End-Tidal Anesthetic Percent Concentrations Successfully Maintained Anesthesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 [just before the start of inhalation of study drug, during anesthetic maintenance (every 5 minutes after the start of inhalation of study drug), at the end of inhalation of study drug, immediately after awakening, and just before extubation]
secondary_outcome.description: Successfully maintaining anesthesia is defined as keeping the patient in stable condition (systolic pressure 80 to <150 mmHg and heart rate 50 to <100bpm) without requiring rescue treatment or additional dose of opioid analgesics (<=2 ug/kg/hr).If patient was found to have body movement, recall, or memory during anesthetic maintenance, data for such patient were to be excluded from summary statistic calculation.

intervention.description: volatile liquid for inhalation with gas for inhalation
volatile liquid for inhalation and gas for inhalation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA PS 1-3
- age: older than 19 y and younger than 70 y
- undergoing surgery of the thorax(thoracotomy, thoracotomy plus laparotomy, endoscopy; but excluding cardiovascular),abdomen(laparotomy,endoscopy;but excluding cesarean section), joints (including peripheral vessels), back (spine)or neck (neck, throat)
- willing to be hospitalized for at least 3 days and 2 nights (from the day before surgery to the day after surgery)
- having given written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- need for spinal subarachnoid, epidural or local anesthesia (except local surface or infiltration anesthesia for catheter insertion or use of local anesthetic for testing before inserting epidural catheter for post-surgical pain)
- contraindication for use of nitrous during surgery
- anticipated need for postoperative transfer to intensive care unit and receive mechanical pulmonary ventilation
- BMI of 30 kg/m2 or more
- serious hepatic, renal, or circulatory disorder (Grade 3 per Notification 80 by MHW, Pharmaceutical Affairs Bureau, Safety Division)
- uncontrollable hypertension (SBP 160 mmHg or higher while on antihypertensive therapy)
- emergency surgery
- history of hypersensitivity to components of sevoflurane, fentanyl, propofol, vecuronium or other anesthetic
- contraindication to sevoflurane, fentanyl, propofol, or vecuronium
- exposure or suspected exposure to inhalational halogenated anesthetic within 3 mo prior to consent
- known or suspected history or family history of malignant hyperthermia
- considered likely to have difficulty in receiving tracheal intubation due to conditions such as brachygnathia, micrognathia, bucked teeth, articular rheumatism or injury of cervical spine/cervical cord
- known or suspected to be pregnant or lactating
- participated in a clinical study within 6 mo prior to consent
- history of drug dependence
- history of epilepsy
- otherwise judged by the investigator to be unsuitable for the study

facility.name: Kagoshima University Medical and Dental University

group.title: BLM 240 N2O Group
group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.title: BLM 240 O2 Group
group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with o2 (>=30%). The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.title: Sevoflurane Group
group.description: Inhalation of sevoflurane was initiated at 1% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

participants_list.participants: N=114 enrolled but 3 participant's discontinued before start of study drug administration.
N=57 enrolled but 2 participant's discontinued before start of study drug administration.
N=53 enrolled but 3 participant's discontinued before start of study drug administration.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Body Movement During Anesthetic Maintenance
outcome.description: The investigator or sub-investigator observed the patient for body movement (excluding bucking) during anesthetic maintenance.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) - subjects assigned to treatment groups, excluding subjects with significant GCP violations (significant violations regarding informed consent and study procedures), subjects who did not receive the allocated study drug, subjects whose ASA status was not Class I, II, III, or subjects for whom no data were available.

outcome.title: Time to Extubation
outcome.description: Evaluation of Awakening/Recovery from Anesthesia from end of study drug inhalation to extubation. The patient was extubated when the following signs were observed:(1) clear consciousness, (2) ability to breathe spontaneously (minute ventilation >=50 mL/kg/min), and (3) stable circulatory dynamics (systolic pressure: >=100 mmHg).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Post-Surgery, from end of study drug inhalation to extubation)

group.title: BLM-240 Group
group.description: Cumulative summary of two BLM 240 treatment Arms, including N2O and O2.

measure.description: Evaluation of Awakening/Recovery from Anesthesia from end of study drug inhalation to extubation. The patient was extubated when the following signs were observed:(1) clear consciousness, (2) ability to breathe spontaneously (minute ventilation >=50 mL/kg/min), and (3) stable circulatory dynamics (systolic pressure: >=100 mmHg).

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Time to extubation = treatment group + surgical site +surgery time

outcome.title: Time to Awakening
outcome.description: Time from the end of study drug inhalation. After the end of inhalation of the study drug, the investigator commanded the patient to open his/her eyes once every minute to check whether he/she awoke and recorded the time of awakening.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Post-Surgery, from the end of study drug inhalation to awakening)

group.title: BLM-240 Group
group.description: Cumulative summary of two BLM 240 treatment Arms, including N2O and O2.

group.title: BLM-240 N2O Group
group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.title: BLM-240 O2 Group
group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with o2 (>=30%). The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.title: Sevoflurane Group
group.description: Inhalation of sevoflurane was initiated at 1% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

measure.title: Time to Awakening
measure.description: Time from the end of study drug inhalation. After the end of inhalation of the study drug, the investigator commanded the patient to open his/her eyes once every minute to check whether he/she awoke and recorded the time of awakening.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Adjusted means of "time from the end of study drug inhalation to extubation" in the BLM-240 N2O group and sevoflurane group, which were obtained by analysis of covariance with surgical site and surgery time as covariates, were used to verify the non-inferiority of BLM-240 to the comparator sevoflurane, with a delta = 1.0 (minute) and significance level alpha = 2.5% (one-sided).

outcome.title: Time to Stating Birth Date
outcome.description: After extubation, the investigator called and asked the patient to state the birth date once every minute and recorded the time the patient could state the birth date. Time from the end of study drug inhalation.

group.title: Sevoflurane Group
group.description: Inhalation of sevoflurane was initiated at 1% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

measure.title: Changes in Bispectral Index (BIS) Over Time During Anethetic Maintenance
measure.description: BIS is used to monitor depth of anesthesia. The BIS monitor provides a single number, which ranges from 0 (equivalent to EEG silence) to 100. A BIS value between 40 and 60 generally indicates an appropriate level for general anesthesia.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Requiring Rescue Medication Due to Rise in Blood Pressure or Heart Rate
outcome.description: Rescue medication can include vasopressors and depressors.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (During surgery, duration ranging <2 hours, 2-4 hours, and ≥4 hours)

group.title: BLM-240 Group
group.description: Cumulative summary of two BLM 240 treatment Arms, including N2O and O2.

group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with o2 (>=30%). The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.title: BLM-240 Group
group.description: Cumulative summary of two BLM 240 treatment Arms, including N2O and O2.

group.title: BLM-240 N2O Group
group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.title: BLM-240 O2 Group
group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with o2 (>=30%). The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.title: Sevoflurane Group
group.description: Inhalation of sevoflurane was initiated at 1% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

measure.title: Number of Participants Requiring Rescue Medication Due to Arrhythmia
measure.description: Rescue medication can include vasopressors and depressors.

outcome.title: Range of End-Tidal Anesthetic Percent Concentrations During Anesthetic Maintenance
outcome.description: Measurement by infrared absorption spectrometry. The concentrations of BLM-240 and sevoflurane at the start of inhalation were set at 3% and 1%,respectively (by vaporizer dial setting). Concentrations are monitored to determine which levels keep the patient in stable condition without requiring rescue treatment.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 [just before the start of inhalation of study drug, during anesthetic maintenance (every 5 minutes after the start of inhalation of study drug), at the end of inhalation of study drug, immediately after awakening, and just before extubation]

group.title: BLM-240 N2O Group
group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.title: BLM-240 O2 Group
group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with o2 (>=30%). The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.title: Sevoflurane Group
group.description: Inhalation of sevoflurane was initiated at 1% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

measure.title: Range of End-Tidal Anesthetic Percent Concentrations During Anesthetic Maintenance
measure.description: Measurement by infrared absorption spectrometry. The concentrations of BLM-240 and sevoflurane at the start of inhalation were set at 3% and 1%,respectively (by vaporizer dial setting). Concentrations are monitored to determine which levels keep the patient in stable condition without requiring rescue treatment.

outcome.title: Range of Inspired Anesthetic Concentrations Below End-Tidal Anesthetic Percent Concentrations During Anesthetic Maintenance
outcome.description: Measurement by infrared absorption spectrometry. Ranges reflecting when concentrations were stable. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 [just before the start of inhalation of study drug, during anesthetic maintenance (every 5 minutes after the start of inhalation of study drug), at the end of inhalation of study drug, and just before extubation]

group.title: BLM-240 Group
group.description: Cumulative summary of two BLM 240 treatment Arms, including N2O and O2.

group.title: Sevoflurane Group
group.description: Inhalation of sevoflurane was initiated at 1% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

measure.title: Range of Inspired Anesthetic Concentrations Below End-Tidal Anesthetic Percent Concentrations During Anesthetic Maintenance
measure.description: Measurement by infrared absorption spectrometry. Ranges reflecting when concentrations were stable. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

outcome.title: End-Tidal Anesthetic Percent Concentrations Successfully Maintained Anesthesia
outcome.description: Successfully maintaining anesthesia is defined as keeping the patient in stable condition (systolic pressure 80 to <150 mmHg and heart rate 50 to <100bpm) without requiring rescue treatment or additional dose of opioid analgesics (<=2 ug/kg/hr).If patient was found to have body movement, recall, or memory during anesthetic maintenance, data for such patient were to be excluded from summary statistic calculation.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 [just before the start of inhalation of study drug, during anesthetic maintenance (every 5 minutes after the start of inhalation of study drug), at the end of inhalation of study drug, immediately after awakening, and just before extubation]

group.title: BLM-240 Group
group.description: Cumulative summary of two BLM 240 treatment Arms, including N2O and O2.

group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.description: Inhalation of BLM-240 was initiated at 3% (vaporizer dial setting) with o2 (>=30%). The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

group.title: Sevoflurane Group
group.description: Inhalation of sevoflurane was initiated at 1% (vaporizer dial setting) with N2O at 50-70%. The inspired concentration was adjusted depending on the patient's condition during anesthetic maintenance (gas flow rate: 2 to 6 L/min).

measure.title: End-Tidal Anesthetic Percent Concentrations Successfully Maintained Anesthesia
measure.description: Successfully maintaining anesthesia is defined as keeping the patient in stable condition (systolic pressure 80 to <150 mmHg and heart rate 50 to <100bpm) without requiring rescue treatment or additional dose of opioid analgesics (<=2 ug/kg/hr).If patient was found to have body movement, recall, or memory during anesthetic maintenance, data for such patient were to be excluded from summary statistic calculation.

reported_events.time_frame: 3 Days before study drug through 7 days after surgery.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
